item.title: bicitrilladora: a one-of-a-kind contraption
item.description: One summer when I was too inexperienced an engineer to find a real internship, I ended up with a volunteer position working at a non-profit working under a Nicaraguan engineer. Needless to say, the summer was an eventful one and I have many good memories and stories from that summer. One of my favorite projects was the design and construction of the “bicitrilladora”. Why this thing? The Nicaraguan non-profit I was working for was set up to improve access to healthcare for extremely rural communities.

item.title: raising fish in my college basement
item.description: While in my last year of university, I became obsessed with the idea of having my own micro aquaponics ecosystem. Then, in a moment of weakness, I bought fifteen tilapa fry on eBay.
